basics.name: Sabrina Tidjini
basics.label: Salesforce Administrator
basics.summary: Specialized in Business Developer over 7 years, I have decided to switch my carreer into Salesforce Administrator. I have been working on multiples platforms that helped me to get my hands on Salesforce CRM. Indeed, so far I'am at 35 badges on Trailhead. I'm active on Salesforce Communities and attend most of the Salesforce events hosted by Accenture.

work.summary: RandomCoffees helps to get to know teammates across companies and encourage them to meet for coffee, walk, lunch, Skype on a weekly basis. RandomCoffees helps teams build a strong relationship and enhance corporate culture.
highlights: Wireframe the RandomCoffees Bot through Slack
Prioritizes features by ranking them against the strategic goals and initiative in the backlog
Work closely with engineering on the technical specifications and ensure that teams have all of the information they need to deliver a complete product to market
Inform the development team about the bugs that the users are facing
Optimizing markets with tens of millions of rows using SQL
Train users on the technical part of the product
In charge of social media communication/marketing
Participate in tech events to promo
MProspect for potential new clinics and turn into the increased business
Cold calls appropriate within the cosmetic surgery market to ensure a robust pipeline of opportunities
Meet potential clinics by growing, maintaining, and leveraging the network
Ensure that data is accurately entered and managed in Edge, sales management system
Attend industry function, such as cosmetic surgery events in Montreal, Toronto, Ottawa, and Vancouver and provide feedback to the management team
Design a marketing survey that yields legitimate results to understand clinics habits and needs
Responsible for performing research and providing insights regarding the market, trends, competitors
Build a strong social media visibility through Facebook/Twitter/Instagram to increase inside application and drive traffic to the Credit Medical Website
Submit weekly progress reports and ensure data is accurate
Work with marketing team to implement new processes to attract more clinics and solve marketing issues
Researching and positioning products in the field of Augmented Reality to enhance sales and revenue
Developing partnership with startups providing AR in France and UK Present plan approaches and pitches of the product to the potential clients
Identified and onboard 6 museums in France contributing to $360K in revenue
Liaise with engineers to translate the client’s needs, concerns, and objectives
Identify, up-sell & cross-sell opportunities within dedicated client base Identify “at- risk” renewal clients early in the cycle and define issues inhibiting a successful, timely renewal
Provide continuous feedback to management on both successes and challenges of the business
Product experience in CRM
Proven expertise in working with the executive level in client environments, as well as with procurement and business owners (Sales, VP, CEO)
Understanding of legal terms in SaaS contracts
work.summary: As the scrum master of one of the three cross-functional teams (focused on marketplace product), worked with the Director of Product to run the agile cadence (daily standups to identify blockers for team members, plan bi-weekly sprints and estimate effort and business value)

highlights: Initiated construction of an onboarding and training framework for the existing account representatives team.
Part of the core ops team and helped create a structure to support multi-million dollar/month transactions
Maintained and developed a rapport with various trade contractors and homeowners to gather user feedback and iterate on the product
Maintained an exceptional level of customer satisfaction
Saleforce was our main CRM software tool
